RFK Jr. becomes filled with emotion as he shares an unforgettable conversation he had with Charlie Kirk about death.

The long pause at the 22-second mark said it all. You could feel how heavily Kirk‚Äôs passing was weighing on him.

‚ÄúWe were talking about the risk that all of us take when we challenge interest, the physical risk. And he asked me if I was scared of dying. And I said to him, there‚Äôs a lot worse things than death. And one of those things is if we lost our constitutional rights in this country and that our children were raised as slaves.

‚ÄúAnd‚Ä¶ (long pause)

‚ÄúI said to Charlie, I said, sometimes the best consolation we can hope for is that we get to die with our boots on. Well, Charlie died with his boots on, and he died to make sure that we didn‚Äôt have to undergo those fates that are worse than death.

‚ÄúSo, let‚Äôs remember Charlie. For those of us who were friends with Charlie, we don‚Äôt need any more evidence of the love of God, because the evidence, the friendship, is the best evidence that God loves us all.

‚ÄúThank you, and God bless you.‚Äù
Charlie Kirk has inspired the future of America and we won‚Äôt let it fail. DJ Daniels and his father are on a mission from God. The lord is moving in this stadium today.

BREAKING üö® It‚Äôs Official: Elon Musk is at Charlie Kirk‚Äôs Memorial. He just posted this video saying:
